heading: digital music do-alls
subheading: a new entrant in the mp3 portable market blurs the line between music player and personal organizer.
author: wired news report
text: before long, the difference between palm pilots and portable digital music players will be a subtle one at best. the newest entrant in the mp3 portable market is ravemp, which doubles as a personal organizer and a voice-message recorder. manufactured by sensory science, the device has a built-in microphone to enter up to four hours of voice messages and can store thousands of telephone numbers and other data.read wired news' ongoing mp3 coverage
